seoData.title: Best ChatGPT Prompts - 20+ Expert Templates | PromptWritingStudio
seoData.description: Discover the best ChatGPT prompts for content creation, business, marketing, and more. Our expert-crafted templates deliver superior results and save you hours of time.

promptTemplates.title: Universal Expert Framework
promptTemplates.description: Transform ChatGPT into a specialized expert in any field.
promptTemplates.prompt: I want you to act as an expert in [field/subject] with 20+ years of experience and a [degree/qualification] background. I'm seeking your guidance on [specific topic or problem]. First, explain the fundamental principles or frameworks relevant to this topic. Then, analyze my specific situation: [describe your situation/question in detail]. Provide detailed, actionable advice based on best practices in the field. Include specific examples, potential challenges I might face, and how to overcome them. If relevant, suggest resources, tools, or techniques that would be most effective. Please avoid basic, generic advice and instead provide insights that demonstrate deep expertise.
promptTemplates.example:
Acting as a Financial Planning Expert with 20+ years of experience and a CFP background:

Fundamental Principles for Early Retirement Planning:
The FIRE (Financial Independence, Retire Early) framework consists of four key pillars: 1) Aggressive saving (typically 50-70% of income), 2) Strategic investing with emphasis on low-cost index funds, 3) Multiple income streams, and 4) Lifestyle optimization...
tips: Be very specific about the expertise you need
Provide detailed context about your situation
Ask for specific frameworks or methodologies relevant to your question

promptTemplates.title: Comprehensive Research Assistant
promptTemplates.description: Get in-depth research on any topic with organized findings.
promptTemplates.prompt: I need comprehensive research on [topic]. Please act as an academic researcher with expertise in this field and provide the following: 1) An executive summary of the key findings (200 words), 2) Historical context and background, 3) Current state of research with 5-7 key subtopics, 4) Analysis of different perspectives or schools of thought, 5) Practical applications or implications, 6) Gaps in current research or limitations, 7) Future trends or predictions, and 8) A bibliography of sources that would be valuable for further research (formatted in [citation style]). For each section, provide specific examples, data points, or case studies where relevant. Organize the information with clear headings and subheadings.
promptTemplates.example:
RESEARCH: IMPACT OF ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE ON EMPLOYMENT MARKETS

Executive Summary:
Artificial intelligence is reshaping employment markets through automation of routine tasks, creation of new job categories, and transformation of existing roles. Current research indicates a nuanced impact rather than wholesale job elimination, with studies showing 14% of global jobs at high risk of automation but 32% likely to be transformed rather than eliminated...
tips: Specify any particular aspects of the topic you're most interested in
Include any specific sources or researchers you want referenced
Mention if you need the research to focus on a particular region or timeframe

promptTemplates.title: Multi-Perspective Decision Analyzer
promptTemplates.description: Analyze decisions from multiple expert perspectives.
promptTemplates.prompt: I'm considering [decision/choice] and need a multi-perspective analysis. Please analyze this decision from the following perspectives, with each analysis written as if by an expert in that field: 1) Financial perspective (ROI, costs, financial risks), 2) Strategic perspective (long-term implications, competitive advantage), 3) Operational perspective (implementation challenges, resource requirements), 4) Risk management perspective (potential pitfalls, contingency planning), 5) [Additional relevant perspective for your situation]. For each perspective, provide: key considerations, potential benefits, potential drawbacks, and specific recommendations. After presenting all perspectives, synthesize the insights into an overall recommendation that balances these different viewpoints. Include any critical questions I should answer before finalizing this decision.
promptTemplates.example:
ANALYSIS: EXPANDING BUSINESS TO INTERNATIONAL MARKETS

Financial Perspective (CFO Analysis):
Key Considerations: Initial capital requirements of $1.2-1.5M, currency exchange risks, tax implications across jurisdictions, and extended ROI timeline.
Potential Benefits: Revenue diversification (reducing market concentration risk by approximately 35%), access to markets with higher growth rates (projected 8.3% vs domestic 2.7%)...
tips: Specify the exact decision you're considering with relevant details
Include industry-specific perspectives that would be valuable
Note any constraints or requirements that should factor into the analysis

promptTemplates.title: Ultimate Content Repurposer
promptTemplates.description: Transform one piece of content into multiple formats.
promptTemplates.prompt: I have created [type of content: blog post, video script, podcast episode] about [topic] with the following key points: [list 3-5 main points or paste content]. Please help me repurpose this into 10 different content pieces for maximum reach across platforms: 1) A thread of 10 tweets with relevant hashtags, 2) 5 LinkedIn posts with professional framing, 3) 3 short-form video scripts (60 seconds each) for TikTok/Instagram Reels, 4) 4 Instagram carousel concepts with 5-7 slides each, 5) An email newsletter version, 6) A long-form YouTube script expanding on the original, 7) 3 Facebook posts optimized for engagement, 8) 5 quote graphics with accompanying captions, 9) A one-page PDF lead magnet outline, and 10) 3 blog post headlines with meta descriptions for SEO. Ensure each format maintains the core message while optimizing for the specific platform's best practices and audience expectations.
promptTemplates.example:
TWITTER THREAD (10 TWEETS):

Tweet 1: We analyzed 1,000+ successful product launches and discovered something surprising: 72% of them used a "soft launch" strategy before their public release. Here's how you can use this approach too... ðŸ§µ #ProductLaunch #StartupStrategy

Tweet 2: Soft Launch Strategy #1: Release to just 100 users who match your ideal customer profile. The goal isn't perfection, but rapid feedback on what actually matters to them...
tips: Provide your original content in full for the best results
Specify your brand voice characteristics for consistent messaging
Mention any specific calls-to-action you want included

promptTemplates.title: Socratic Learning Method
promptTemplates.description: Learn any concept deeply through guided questioning.
promptTemplates.prompt: I want to learn about [concept/topic] using the Socratic method. Act as an expert teacher on this subject and guide me through a series of thoughtful questions and answers that will help me develop a deep understanding. Start with fundamental concepts and progressively move to more complex aspects. For each round: 1) Ask me a thought-provoking question about the topic, 2) After I respond, provide constructive feedback on my understanding, correcting any misconceptions with explanations, 3) Add additional context, examples, or insights that deepen my understanding, 4) Then pose a follow-up question that builds on the previous discussion and challenges me to think more deeply or apply the concept. If I'm struggling, provide hints rather than immediate answers. Cover both theoretical understanding and practical applications of the concept.
promptTemplates.example:
I'll guide you through learning about cognitive biases using the Socratic method.

Question 1: What do you think it means when we say humans are subject to "cognitive biases" in their thinking, and why might understanding these biases be important?

[After your response]

Feedback: You've correctly identified that cognitive biases are systematic patterns of deviation from rationality in judgment. Your point about biases being shortcuts is insightful...
tips: Specify your current level of understanding of the topic
Mention any specific aspects of the topic you're most interested in
Indicate how theoretical vs. practical you want the discussion to be

faqs.question: What makes these prompts better than basic ChatGPT prompts?
faqs.answer: These prompts are superior because they incorporate advanced prompting techniques like role specification, detailed context provision, multi-step instructions, and specific output formatting. They're designed based on extensive testing to overcome ChatGPT's limitations such as vagueness, hallucinations, and generic responses. Each prompt includes specific elements that elicit more detailed, accurate, and useful responses by providing clear guidance on exactly what information to include and how to structure it.

faqs.question: How should I modify these prompts for my specific needs?
faqs.answer: To customize these prompts, first identify which sections need modification while preserving the overall structure that makes them effective. Replace placeholder text (in brackets) with your specific details. Add context about your particular situation, industry terminology, or requirements. Adjust the output format to match your preferences by modifying the numbered list of requested elements. For best results, maintain the prompt's instruction clarity and specificity even as you customize the content.

faqs.question: Can I combine multiple prompt templates for more complex tasks?
faqs.answer: Yes, combining prompts can be very effective for complex tasks. The best approach is to identify the core elements from each prompt that are relevant to your task and integrate them into a cohesive structure. Maintain the clear instruction format and specificity from each source prompt. For very complex tasks, consider using a sequential approach where you use one prompt to generate initial content, then feed that output into a second prompt for refinement or transformation.

faqs.question: How do I know which prompt will work best for my specific situation?
faqs.answer: Select prompts based on your desired outcome rather than your input type. Consider what format and depth of information would be most valuable to you. For exploratory work, choose prompts that emphasize multiple perspectives or comprehensive research. For practical tasks, select prompts focused on actionable outputs. When uncertain, the Universal Expert Framework is often a good starting point as it can be adapted to most situations. Don't hesitate to experiment with different prompts for the same task to see which produces the most useful results for your specific needs.
